oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Pvt. Perry Benjamin Austin and fellow motor truck drivers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Perry Benjamin Austin and members of Motor Truck Co. 536 share a few bottles and a toast in France in this undated photograph. Pvt. Austin is indicated by an arrow. He served in France until June 1919. A mink trapper before the war, he ran a trolley car in Jackson, Tennessee after World War I, and later worked as a carpenter. [See also GWjack001-GWjack010.]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Austin, Perry Benjamin
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
